news.title: Ahmedabad civic body collects impact fee for two houses built on government land
news.para: Members of Devmandir Co-operative Housing Society in Ghatlodia allege Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation officials collected illegal impact fees. The fees were for two houses built on government land, falsely linked to their society. An appeal was filed under the Gruda Act, 2022, seeking cancellation of the applications and legal action against officials. Evidence suggests the houses are not on society land.

news.title: Illegal construction rampant in Raisina hill; boundary walls, roads razed & borewells sealed
news.para: Forest officials in Gurgaon demolished illegal structures and boundary walls spanning 25 acres in the protected Aravalis, following National Green Tribunal directives. A borewell was sealed, and roads accessing the forest were blocked. Despite repeated drives and court orders, construction persists, with environmentalists questioning the administration's commitment to enforcement.

news.title: India office leasing touches 86.4 million sq ft in 2025: Report
news.para: In 2025, India's office market  achieved 86.4 million sq ft in gross leasing volumes, marking a 20% increase compared to 2024. Bengaluru emerged as the frontrunner, witnessing a surge in leasing activities, while Global Capability Centres significantly fueled the demand.

news.title: Hyderabad: ED files supplementary complaint in Sahiti Infratec money laundering case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a supplementary prosecution complaint against two key accused in the Sahiti Infratec Ventures India Pvt Ltd fraud case. The ED's money-laundering probe alleges over 700 homebuyers were duped of approximately ₹360 crore by SIVIPL, which operated without necessary approvals and diverted funds through dubious transactions.

news.title: EAAA Alternatives raises ₹2,500 crore through multi-strategy real assets fund
news.para: EAAA Alternatives has successfully raised over Rs 2,500 crore for its new multi-strategy real assets fund. This marks a significant milestone for India's alternative investment sector. The fund will invest in diverse real asset segments like energy and transport. It aims for predictable cash flows and steady returns. EAAA's real assets business manages substantial assets under management across multiple funds.

news.title: Bengaluru development body shifting focus to apartment projects for better land use
news.para: The Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) is shifting its focus from plotted layouts to apartments for efficient land use, aiming for faster housing delivery. Despite this strategic pivot, BDA's apartment sales data reveals a mixed picture, with a significant portion of its housing inventory remaining unsold, prompting a revamp of its marketing strategy.

news.title: Wipro leases over 1.45 lakh sq ft office space in Navi Mumbai’s Mindspace Airoli
news.para: Wipro has secured a large office space in Navi Mumbai's Mindspace Airoli East. The IT major will occupy 1.45 lakh sq ft on a long-term lease. This move highlights sustained demand for cost-efficient offices in peripheral business districts. The lease agreement includes a rent-free period for fit-outs. Rentals will escalate annually. This expansion reinforces Wipro's diversified office footprint.

news.title: Gurugram: Intensive checks to track building code, OC violations in DLF 1-5 after HC order
news.para: The Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) has initiated a comprehensive verification drive in DLF phases 1-5, following a Punjab and Haryana High Court order. This drive aims to scrutinize violations of sanctioned building plans and occupation certificates in licensed plotted colonies. Property owners have until January 16 to submit their representations, which will be cross-verified through on-site inspections.

news.title: Ideal Cures’ promoters buy two apartments in Mumbai’s Worli for ₹190 crore
news.para: Promoters of Ideal Cures, Suresh Pareek and Veena S Pareek, have acquired two luxury apartments in Mumbai's Worli for over Rs 190.1 crore. The combined 12,114 sq ft deal, registered on December 24, includes 10 car parking spaces and reflects continued demand for large-format premium homes from business families.

news.title: Goa: After protests, town planning department stops Carambolim housing project
news.para: Construction of a mega housing project in Carambolim has been halted following local protests. The Town & Country Planning Department issued a stop-work order due to alleged violations concerning crematorium proximity and road access. Villagers claim discrepancies between approved plans and site reality, prompting a review by the Chief Minister.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh slashes stamp duty & registration charges on rent agreements by 90%
news.para: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet has approved new measures to simplify property matters.   Stamp duty and registration charges on rent agreements have been cut by up to 90 percent.  The decisions aim to reduce disputes and promote formal agreements, enhancing ease of living in the state.

news.title: Gurugram: ED attaches over ₹50-crore worth assets of  Ocean Seven Buildtech
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has confiscated assets exceeding Rs 50 crore amid an ongoing investigation into a money laundering scheme. The focus is on Ocean Seven Buildtech Pvt Ltd, a company based in Gurugram, along with its promoter, Swaraj Singh Yadav, who are accused of defrauding homebuyers. Allegedly, funds intended for housing projects were misappropriated.

news.title: Lodha Developers' sales bookings up 25% to ₹5,620 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Lodha Developers registered pre-sales of Rs 5,620 crore in the December quarter, marking a 25 percent year-on-year growth. The company also collected Rs 3,560 crore during the same period. The company remains confident in meeting its annual sales target of Rs 21,000 crore.

news.title: Holcim acquires French precast concrete maker Alkern
news.para: Swiss building materials maker Holcim has acquired French precast concrete firm Alkern. This move is part of Holcim's strategy to boost sales from building solutions.The acquisition is expected to be profitable from the first year.

news.title: Construction work banned in Bhubaneswar, Cuttack from 6 pm to 10 am to curb pollution
news.para: In a bid to combat soaring air pollution levels, Bhubaneswar and Cuttack have introduced a night-time construction ban. Effective from 6 PM to 10 AM, this regulation applies to both public and private construction projects. To comply, builders are required to securely cover materials and regularly dampen work sites.

news.title: Ludhiana: F&CC clears key works, cost rise in C&D plant sparks questions
news.para: Ludhiana's Finance and Contracts Committee approved 115 resolutions, including the redevelopment of major chowks under the National Clean Air Programme. The cost of the construction and demolition waste plant also increased to Rs 8.46 crore due to boundary wall expansion and revised piling methods. Concerns were raised regarding a central verge construction project.

news.title: Railway gets ₹1,368-crore bid for nearly six-acre land parcel in central Mumbai
news.para: Dineshchandra R Agrawal Infracon is the only bidder for the land parcel to be redeveloped on a revenue share model through a long-term lease agreement. The reserve price for the plot, which will be allotted through a 99-year lease, was Rs 1,343 crore.

news.title: One accused, over 100 victims and ₹2 crore PMAY fraud in Ahmedabad
news.para: A man, Neel Madhav Patel, is accused of duping over 100 women of more than Rs 2 crore. He allegedly promised them houses under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana without any formal process. Victims paid large sums for direct allotments and upgrades. When questioned, Patel issued bounced cheques.

news.title: Kolkata civic body launches city-wide drive to demolish dilapidated, insecure buildings
news.para: Following a building collapse, the Kolkata Municipal Corporation is launching a city-wide demolition drive for dilapidated and insecure structures. The KMC Buildings Department will use special powers to raze buildings posing a threat to residents and pedestrians, with over 150 identified for immediate action. The civic body is also offering incentives for reconstruction to accommodate existing tenants.

news.title: RBI urges NBFCs, HFCs to maintain sound underwriting standards, close monitoring of asset quality
news.para: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra convened with executives from prominent Non-Banking Financial Companies. He emphasized the necessity for robust underwriting practices and meticulous asset quality evaluations. The Governor also underscored the importance of prioritizing customer needs and embracing responsible lending practices.
